title: Best cheap shampoo and conditioner duos that really for under £10
text:

Finding an affordable shampoo and conditioner duo that actually do what they say on the label can seem like an impossible task.

But affordable haircare you can find on the high-street and online is better than ever, and now you can easily find products that target your exact hair concern.

Whether it's dryness, damage or an oily scalp that you want to sort, there's a duo out there for you.

Top high street retailers like Boots and Superdrug are a treasure trove for finding the latest brands and new products, while online retailers like Amazon, ASOS and Lookfantastic offer a huge variety of haircare brands that will be delivered to your door at the click of a button.

We've been busy testing out the newest ones that promise to make 2019 your best (and most affordable) hair year yet.

Beauty director Lynne says: ‘My hair settled down easily and smoothly when

I blow-dried it, and looked shiny without much effort. Good for battling fine, fluff-prone hair.’

Beauty writer Zoe says: ‘These are meant to leave hair grease-free for longer. Mine did feel clean and without residue, and the smell is nice, but they gave my blonde hair a slight ashy tinge.'

Tester Izzy says: ‘I have a sensitive scalp, so I avoid products that strip my hair. This was quite calming and once my hair was dry, I thought it looked polished and less fluffy.'

Fashion assistant Megan says: ‘The shampoo smells AMAZING! My dry ends felt softer after just one go, and my roots took longer to get oily too. My new go-to.’

Tester Jules says: ‘These two are amazing. They left my hair soft with no grease at all. The shampoo is very thick, but still easy to lather, and overall my hair is a lot softer and smoother than normal. Love!’
description: Is your hair in need of a detox? These duos promise to soften, smooth and cleanse your locks all for under a tenner
